alert.note: Alert for Forsyth (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 3:20AM EST until January 25 at 11:16PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Peachtree City GA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek at GA 9 near Cumming affecting Forsyth County. For the Big Creek...including Cumming...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Creek at GA 9 near Cumming. * WHEN...From early this morning to late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor flooding continues to expand into the natural flood plain of the creek upstream and downstream from the gage at Atlanta Highway or Georgia Highway 9. Large portions of the sidewalk and boardwalk of the Big Creek Greenway will be flooded. The areas under the Georgia 400 Highway and McFarland Road will be covered with around two feet of water. A portion of the sidewalk under Majors Road will be covered with around 3 feet of water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 AM EST Thursday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 6.5 feet late this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.5 feet on 03/26/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 330 PM EST.
